definition: earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: The natives have been warring over this small piece of land without either side winning.
sentences.chinese: 土人一直在爭奪這一小片土地，雙方相持不下。

sentences.english: Some native Americans are still living in poverty.
sentences.chinese: 一些美洲土人仍然生活在貧困之中。

sentences.english: Only then autochthon over 10 individuals, small.
sentences.chinese: 當時土人只有10多個人，規模很小。

sentences.english: She’s learning the world person by person and place by place.
sentences.chinese: 她在瞭解世界各地的風土人情。

sentences.english: This book, "A General Survey of North America", introduces local conditions and customs of the US in detail.
sentences.chinese: 這本《北美概觀》詳細地介紹了美國的風土人情。

sentences.english: The case of Jinian, natives of their number for the "yellow pit."
sentences.chinese: 如是積年，土人號其地爲“黃坑”。

sentences.english: The white people here don't mix socially with the natives.
sentences.chinese: 這裏的白種人不與土人交往。

sentences.english: They tried to civilize the natives.
Ask questions about the food as well as the culture and customs.
sentences.chinese: 多聊聊食物之外，還可以暢談中國文化和風土人情。

sentences.english: Suddenly, his fingers hit the wrong strings.
sentences.chinese: 土人，他的手指彈錯了弦。

sentences.english: "There are always natives passing through, " he said stubbornly.
sentences.chinese: “這兒經常有土人經過呢，”他頑固地說。

sentences.english: The natives were crazy about dancing.
sentences.chinese: 這幫土人對跳舞可入迷了。

sentences.english: She put together a PowerPoint presentation on the people and culture of Vietnam.
sentences.chinese: 她用幻燈片展示了越南的風土人情。

sentences.english: Do you want to experience the customs in countryside with overseas students?
sentences.chinese: 你想和留學生一同領略鄉間的風土人情嗎？

sentences.english: The scenery and people on this side were very different from those in her village.
sentences.chinese: 這邊的風土人情與她村裏的大不相同。

definition: common term for non-Han peoples in former times, not exclusively derogatory/barbarian
nomadic/to move about in search of pasture/to rove around as a nomad
ethnic groups in the north and west of China in ancient times/foreigner/barbarian
barbarian/slave servant/(old) contemptuous term for people from southern China (used by northern Chinese people)
villager/(Tw) (Internet slang) person who likes to follow online discussions and add their opinions
